title: "UNICEF Data Analysis"
format: html
execute:

::: {#1218b757 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
from plotnine import *

# Load the data
df = pd.read_csv("../unicef_indicator_1.csv")

# Scatter plot with regression line
scatter_plot = (
    ggplot(df[df['indicator'] == "Deaths aged 5 to 9"])
    + aes(x='time_period', y='obs_value')
    + geom_point()
    + geom_smooth(method='lm')
    + labs(title="Scatter Plot with Regression Line", x="Year", y="Deaths")
)
scatter_plot.save("scatter_plot.png", width=8, height=6, dpi=300)

# Time series plot
time_series = (
    ggplot(df[df['indicator'] == "Deaths aged 5 to 9"])
    + aes(x='time_period', y='obs_value', group=1)
    + geom_line()
    + labs(title="Time Series of Deaths (Age 5-9)", x="Year", y="Deaths")
)
time_series.save("time_series.png", width=8, height=6, dpi=300)

# Bar chart
bar_chart = (
    ggplot(df[df['indicator'] == "Deaths aged 5 to 9"])
    + aes(x='time_period')
    + geom_bar()
    + labs(title="Bar Chart of Deaths (Age 5-9)", x="Year", y="Deaths")
)
bar_chart.save("bar_chart.png", width=8, height=6, dpi=300)
```

## Bar Chart
![Bar Chart](bar_chart.png)
# World map plot
from plotnine.data import world

# Merge UNICEF data with world map
world_data = pd.merge(world, df[df['indicator'] == "Deaths aged 5 to 9"], 
                      left_on='name', right_on='location', how='left')

# Plot world map
world_map = (
    ggplot(world_data)
    + aes(x='long', y='lat', group='group', fill='obs_value')
    + geom_polygon(color="white")
    + scale_fill_continuous(name="Deaths", na_value='gray')
    + labs(title="World Map of Deaths Aged 5 to 9")
    + coord_fixed()
)
world_map.save("world_map.png", width=10, height=6, dpi=300)
![World Map of Deaths Aged 5 to 9](world_map.png)
